title: 112_hr6082
content: The Act is titled the "Congressional Replacement of President Obama's Energy-Restricting and Job-Limiting Offshore Drilling Plan." It defines terms like "OCS Planning Area" and "Proposed Final Outer Continental Shelf Oil & Gas Leasing Program (2012-2017)." The Act requires the implementation of the proposed oil and gas leasing program for 2012-2017. The Act mandates the implementation of the Proposed Final Outer Continental Shelf Oil & Gas Leasing Program (2012-2017) according to the specified schedule and applicable laws. Additionally, the Secretary is required to conduct modified and additional lease sales in OCS Planning Areas as outlined in the Act. Lease Sale No. in various OCS Planning Areas in 2012 and 2013 include Western Gulf of Mexico, Mid-Atlantic, Eastern Gulf of Mexico, Central Gulf of Mexico, Southern California, Cook Inlet. In 2013 and 2014, lease sales were conducted in various OCS Planning Areas including Chukchi Sea, Southern California, Mid-Atlantic, Central Gulf of Mexico, Western Gulf of Mexico, Beaufort Sea, and North Atlantic. In 2015, lease sales were held in Mid-Atlantic, North Atlantic, Eastern Gulf of Mexico, and Central Gulf of Mexico. Lease sales were conducted in various OCS Planning Areas including Chukchi Sea, North Aleutian Basin, Beaufort Sea, Southern California, Mid-Atlantic, Central Gulf of Mexico, Western Gulf of Mexico, Eastern Gulf of Mexico, and South Atlantic-South Carolina from 2015 to 2017. Lease sales were conducted in South Atlantic-South Carolina in 2015. Lease sales in various regions will be conducted in accordance with specific leasing programs for the years specified. Lease sales numbers 249 and 250 will be conducted for specific lease tracts in the Southern California OCS Planning Area and Mid-Atlantic OCS Planning Area, respectively, as determined by the Secretary. The sales will take place in the specified year for each lease sale according to the table in subsection (b) and in accordance with the provisions of the Act. SEC. 4. SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE LEASE SALE. The Secretary will offer leases for tracts in Santa Maria and Santa Barbara/Ventura Basins of the Southern California OCS Planning Area by December 31, 2013. Leases will require development from existing offshore infrastructure or onshore-based drilling. The Act does not affect the Secretary of Defense's authority to designate national defense areas on the Outer Continental Shelf. No oil or gas activities on the Shelf should conflict with military operations as per the Memorandum of Agreement between the Department of Defense and the Department of the Interior. The Act does not impact the Secretary of Defense's ability to designate national defense areas on the Outer Continental Shelf. Oil or gas activities on the Shelf should not interfere with military operations as outlined in the Memorandum of Agreement between the Department of Defense and the Department of the Interior. SEC. 6. ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT STATEMENT REQUIREMENT. The Secretary of the Interior must prepare a multisale environmental impact statement for lease sales required by the Act. The statement does not need to consider nonleasing alternatives or analyze their environmental effects, only identifying a preferred leasing action. The Secretary of the Interior must prepare a multisale environmental impact statement for lease sales required by the Act, identifying a preferred leasing action and analyzing environmental effects and potential mitigation measures for the preferred action and alternative leasing proposal. SEC. 7. Eastern Gulf of Mexico is excluded from the Act. SEC. 8. Lease sales off the coasts of South Carolina and California require consultation with state officials and focus on areas with promising energy resources. Passed by the House of Representatives on July 25, 2012.
